post.title: NZ Open: Doubles Day 2
post.content:
Game 4

Opponents Jared Keeman & Jarrod Coutts.

  1. Keeman low standard opening.
  2. Stephen short duffer.
  3. Coutts hits duffer hard. Leaves double from b baulk.
  4. I hit but roll to partner touched, failed to get in front of 1.
  5. Coutts missed.
  6. I groveled through 3, cornered.
  7. Coutts missed me.
  8. I made good break until stuck in 3b.
  9. Coutts make 8.
  10. Stephen missed long lift.
  11. Keeman went out after 3 with take off to Stephen in C4.
  12. Stephen played a beautiful quad.

We have now qualified for quarters, one block round to go.

Game 5

Opponent Aaron Westerby & Toby Garrison. Top seeds in block. Both pairs are undefeated.

  1. Aaron standard opening.
  2. Stephen hit, sit wide double near peg.
  3. Toby hit from C1. After 4 Toby put pioneer through H6. Didn’t get rush after H5. Croquet shot a little short and wired, runs to C4.
  4. I hit ball at penult. Set 1b leave which I was unaware I was doing until after H4.
  5. Toby missed tea lady.
  6. Stephen made beautiful sextuple.

Quarter Finals

Opponents Bruce and Liz Fleming. Our 3rd married couple out of 6 games.

  1. Liz low standard opening.
  2. Stephen just out of C2.
  3. Bruce missed long shot at Liz.
  4. I missed Liz.
  5. Liz set.
  6. Stephen to C4.
  7. Liz makes H1 but fails to get in front of H2, retires to partner.
  8. I hit 15 yarder. Got break under reasonable control but missed 4-5 yarder after H2.
  9. Liz hit 4 yarder and finishes to 4b.
  10. Stephen missed long lift.
  11. Bruce failed H1.
  12. I missed Stephen in C4.
  13. Bruce missed Liz nead H2.
  14. Stephen’s take off goes out next to Bruce.
  15. Bruce goes to peg. During break we learn quarters and semis are best of 1.
  16. Stephen missed me at peg.
  17. Liz finishes. Our event is over.

Summary

I learnt a lot from Stephen and enjoyed turning up and being told where to place balls. Day off tomorrow. Singles start Tuesday.

post.title: NZ Open: Double Day 1
post.content:
Game 1

Opponents were David Wickham & Ambrose Liefting. It was there first event for several years.

  1. Stephen went standard opening East Boundary.
  2. David shot at Stephen leaving touching balls.
  3. I hit and finished the 9. h4 and 2b were more anglying than comfortable but the hoops were wide and loose so got through both times. Great confidence booster for the week ahead to finish the 9.
  4. Ambrose missed the long lift.
  5. Stephen finished the triple.

Unfortunately for David & Ambrose the same happened in the next game against Westerby & Garrison except David did hit with second ball but failed h1.

Game 2

Opponents Sue & Len Lea.

  1. Stephen went standard opening.
  2. Sue C2.
  3. I hit Stephen, pulled up short to C2 and missed.
  4. Len missed.
  5. I missed after h2.
  6. …
  7. …
  8. …
  9. …
  10. Sue finished 9.
  11. Stephen tpo’ed.
  12. Took me about 4 tur ns to finish.

Game 3

Opponents Alison & John Wall. Alison and John had a few turns before Stephen took croquet and made 9. I completed 2 peels after 6 but failed to get rush on 1b pioneer and then failed the hoop. Few more in and outs before Stephen took croquet to make rover and set cross wire and h1 and me near c2. They missed and I finished.

post.title: NZ Open: Travel Day
post.content:
Thursday 14/10/2010 taxi picked me up and 4:40am (5 minutes early) to start my trip to Wanganui, New Zealand for the NZ Open. Despite the crap service I wrote about from Virgin/Pacific Blue the trip was uneventful.

Canberra to Sydney flight landed about 5 minutes early.

Had a wonderful breakfast at Danks Street Depot in the Airport. Ordered croissant ($6) with side of bacon ($5). OK, the croissant was not heated and a tad expensive but the bacon was massive. I’d say at least 7 good sized rashes. Unbelievable for $5.00.

Sydney to Wellington flight landed about 15 minutes early. Immigration and customs was a breeze.

Took a while for the rental car company to pick us up but all went straight forward after that.

It was about 4:40 pm when we head for the “2:15” drive to Wanganui. That might be true if you don’t hit peak hour traffic, stop for dinner or then get lost in Wanganui looking for the hotel. Robert assured us he saw the street we were on on Google earth and it was near the hotel. Well he might be number 10 on the croquet ranking list but he’s not a good guide, we were way on the wrong side of town.

Anyway found the hotel at around 8:20pm. It basic but clean and will suit us well for the week.

post.title: How Virgin Blue/Pacific Blue pissed me off
post.content:
For some time now were possible I’ve avoided flying Virgin Blue. For the trip to NZ 14 Jan 2010 I flew Virgin Blue/Pacific Blue as this was the flight the Fletcher’s had already booked and I am sharing accommodation with them. I will now only fly Virgin Blue/Pacific Blue if I have no other reasonable choice.

This is how they pissed me off this time.

Virgin Blue, 14/1/2010, Canberra to Sydney

  • They ask you to be checked in 60 minutes before departure. Advise you to allow time for queues and actually be checked in 60 minutes before departure. 60 minutes seems a long time to me.
  • On 14/1/2010 I had a 6:15 departure from Canberra to Sydney. Arrive at 4:55, we do not open for another 5 minutes Sir. 5:05 they open. So they expect us to arrive at the check in queue, assuming no long lines, between 62 and 70 minutes before departure.
  • The call to gate was 15 minutes prior to when we could actually start passing through the gate. I had stuff to do on the Internet. That 15 minutes would have been handy.
  • No sandwiches on Canberra to Sydney flight. Muffins or muesli bars.
  • 27 passengers on a 737 but many people were seated next to strangers.

Pacific Blue, 14/10/2010, Sydney to Wellington

  • Departure lounge is dark and dingy.
  • Very few seats at our gate. None available.
  • Sat in seats at neighbouring gate. None of heard the call, just saw others boarding.
  • Did not have boarding pass at photo page of passport. Pacific Blue employee tells all passengers to have boarding pass at photo page of passport unlike the current passenger, me.
  • No hot food on flight.

But all this is nothing compared to the way David was treated. David’s leg was playing up so he was using an airport wheelchair. As soon as the Pacific Blue employee saw David, in a harsh tone tells David “you’ve got to come with me now so we can load you on the plane”, this is 45 minutes before depature. David and Greg go to where instructed, employee has walked off. Greg leaves to find Robert who is getting breakfast and I stay with David. 5 minutes later employee turns up to

  • Employee: “right I have to load you on plane now”
  • David: “I have to wait for my sons, I have their passports and boarding passes”
  • Employee: “Leave them on the counter here, they’ll get them.

I take the passports and David is whisked away like a piece of luggage to be boarded on the plane.

Just a few nice words said in the right tone and all would be good.

Bye, bye Virgin/Pacific Blue. Hope never to fly with you again.
post.post-name: How Virgin Blue/Pacific Blue pissed me off

post.title: NSW Men’s Open Day 3
post.content:
Good day today.

The pressure was on in the first game. I had to beat Trevor to make the top super block. Having missed my duffers tice and then h2 to c4 shot I was staring down the barrel of a –26tp loss. Sadly for Trevor with 2 peels done he failed to get in front of 4b. I hit the 3 yarder, and made 9. Trev missed but I could not start. Trev hit 20 yard partner ball but then missed 3 yarder on me. I did 12 then 5.

Pete did virtually the exact same thing as Trev. Though this time I made 9 with good leave and started ontime triple only to poorly rush to behind 6 then  could not get in front of hoop with peelee in the way. Pete hit made 4b and penult, I missed 14 yarder, Pete made rover, I missed 27 yarder, Pete finished.

Beat John Levick +18tp.

Nick and I pegged down with me h1 & 1, Nick h1 & 5.

My chances of making the final evaporated after losing to Pete but beating Alan and Nick is important.

post.title: NSW Men’s Open Day 1 & 2
post.content:
Day 1. Roqueting was poor, croquet shots were average but 3 wins from 3. 2TPs and in the other game completed 3 peels, rover hoop in the way to go for peg out and bombard failed. Only conceded 1 hoop and 2 errors.

Day 2. Awful. Lost all 3 games. Had game on mallet in first game but failed hoop 2. Games two and three lost to TPs but I did make errors to let opponents in.

I have to beat Trevor tomorrow to make the top super block.

There are 7 players in each block, top 4 from each going into super block. I’ll just list the contenders to qualify for top super block.

Block A (from 6 games)

  • Peter Landrebe (6)
  • John Levick (5)
  • Alan Honey (5)
  • Nick Macoun (4)

Block B

  • Trevor Bassett (5/6)
  • Stephen Richards (5/6)
  • Alan Walsh (5/6)
  • Tim Murphy (3/6)
  • Martyn Prins (4/6)

post.title: Busy time at work
post.content: After returning from Florida I came down with a bad flu. It was at the height of the swine flu scare so we were quarantined and tested but negative. However the flu really hit be me for six. No work for 2 weeks. Since getting back to work I’ve been working flat out. Had little time for croquet (nor the great desire) so practice has been light on. Practice has picked up a little in the last 2 weeks as the NSW Men’s Open starts in 9 hours. Hope to provide you will daily posts. Time to sleep, catch up tomorrow.

post.title: Bookmark with Twitter
post.content:
In my job I often read "technical" blogs knowing I will need the refer back to them later. Of course I can bookmark them but then they get in the way of the everyday bookmarks and the page title is often not very useful. I think the answer is the tweet them instead.

Create the Tweet

The format of the tweet is: Description #bm url.

Description: is your description of the page you are bookmarking.

#bm: is the twitter tag to retrieve bookmarks by. You can use whatever ever tag you like just be consistent and short, you only have 140 characters in a tweet.

url: Is the address you are bookmarking. If you are using www.tweetdeck.com then you are easily shorten the url.

Example: Create bookmarks with Twitter #bm http://bit.ly/2MOKO

View Bookmarks

To view you bookmarks simply do a twitter search:

http://search.twitter.com/search?&tag=<tag name>&from=<your twitter name>

tag name: is the tag you are using for bookmarks. Mine is bm. Do not include the # symbol here.

your twitter name: duh!

To view my bookmarks go to: http://search.twitter.com/search?&tag=bm&from=timpmurphy

A quick google search does show tools to do similar for the moment at least I'm sticking to my idea. With a bit of creative thinking I'm sure you can come up with other ways to file your life using twitter.

comment.title: re: Bookmark with Twitter
comment.content: If you're using TweetDeck then you can create a search window search column. The search phrase for me is: #bm from:timpmurphy

post.title: LAX is a shithole
post.content: I've known for a long time that LAX is a shithole of an airport but the terminal I'm in for V Australia must be the shithole of all shitholes. Words can't describe it and/or I'm too tired to do so. The very few good places to plug in the PC are taken so I'm at a  "Samsung" charging centre. All plugs are taken but fortunately one was taken by and Aussie and she happily let me use my double adapter so we are both charging. The table around the power points is tiny, can't even fit the entire PC on it and its just got 2 stools around it. So that's enough from me for now. I'll leave the PC plugged in and sit in a more comfortable chair while it charges.

comment.title: re: LAX is a shithole
comment.content: Plus its hot in here. Did they not pay the electricity bill!!!

comment.title: re: LAX is a shithole
comment.content: 20 minutes until boarding. Final blog entry on Worlds "What did I learn" may be written on the plane but don't expect it to be published until Thursday or Friday. Can't wait to get home to see Nicky.

comment.title: re: LAX is a shithole
comment.content: If you think that the terminal for VAustralia is bad you really should count your blessings that you didn't fly Qantas...cause in my opinion, the Qantas terminal is WAY worse than VAustralia's! Glad you are back!

post.title: Worlds 2009, All Done!
post.content:
Sorry for the delay on my last days play but it didn't end until 10 mins before the official dinner.

At the start of the day the manager simply allowed anyone who wanted to play the in Z knockout to enter and it was a random draw. 3 of the top 4 players drew onto the same side of the draw; myself, Stephen Forster & Ian Lines. Brian Cumming was on the otherside with a relatively easy draw.

My first game was against Andrew Winn, England. It was a battle with my roquet not that great. In the end I hit a cross court roquet, pegged Andrew out for 4b & box vs 2b & peg. I played the end game well to win +3 with 8 minutes to spare.

Second game was against Stephen Forster, Victoria Australia. Played very well in this game except for sticking in 2b and 1b. Won the game +7.

Third game against Ian Lines, England. I made 4th turn 9 and Ian hit in. He made a few mistakes but I could not hit, each shot not shorter than 12 yards or if I did hit in it was with 4b ball and despite good long leaves Ian hit. Finally I got back when Ian was 4b & 4b. Only got to peel 4b staight with good leave but of course Ian hit. I got back in but failed penult, Ian hit and finished with leave, I missed and lost the game. Ian said the better player did not win which was nice (and correct). He said the same thing about his final but he won that too.

Robert Fletcher played great in the semi against Reg but lost in 4. Reg went on to win the Final quite easily against Ben Rothman 3-0.

It was a great tournament. It was a great thrill to be there to see how well the Fletcher boys did especially Robert.

I'm currently in Atlanta airport, having a smoke. Will make another post about what I learnt when in LA. Home in 30 hours!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 6, Report 2
post.content:
Its only taken 6 days, and its all too late, but I finally proved I could play croquet today.

Lost the second round of Plate Process to Danny Hunneycutt. Start TPO but fell a bit short on ball at h5, hit it but squirted strikers out on stop shot, made hoop but could not hit. Danny hit with penult and ran to peg. I missed, Danny finished.

Played 3rd game of Z against Charlie Gillmartin USA. Just half an error not getting started after the leave. Opponent missed my next leave, finished with TP.

Played 4th game of Z against James Hopgood Scotland. Hit 3rd turn but backward take off to H2 turned with into leg. James made 1, I hit laid up, finished 9, finished TP.

I've won all 4 Z games. Don't know how many I need to have played but expect I will be in Z quarter finals tomorrow. Management pretty much has "who cares" attitude toward plate and Z so little information to know what's going on.

Robert Fletches AUS played brilliantly today beating James Death 3 - 1. Robert has two time world champion Reg Bamford (the only remaining seed) tomorrow. Reg's shooting is down on reputation. It should be a great match. Robert is the first Australian to make semis of the worlds. Go Robert.

Speaking of Reg I didn't meet him last worlds but have this one and he is a great guy. I've had a couple of drinks and chats with him. Then this afternoon seal the deal of being a great guy he gave Malcolm Fletcher aged 13 one of his pidcock mallets (A$700-800). When asked Malcolm confirmed he will be taking it to bed with him tonight :-).

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 6, Report 2
comment.content: pity Bamford didn't have a mallet for Greg also. I imagine Mr Pidcock himself will be trying to give one to Robert

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 6, Report 2
comment.content: Well done baby. And wow, isn't Reg a great guy!

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 6, Report 2
comment.content: Hey Tim hope the afterworlds party is good.....or that in the bar at the airport? speaking of which do you need to be picked you get back to canberra? Jim Nichols came second in platinum singles i think. Alan

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 6, Report 1
post.content:
Robert's playing James Death and is making the first break after Robert put out supershot, James C2, Robert missed in C2, James missed, Robert now making H3. I'm doing this while being protected by Simon Watkins' representives from the Victorian Croquet Association.

 

Photo courtersy Kevin Beard.

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 6, Report 1
comment.content:
Given his articles on the Cairnlea Bob Alman must appreciate the VCA reps!
Rob 1 up v Death. I'm green with envy ..... the little engine who could.

post.title: All Great Britian MacRob players out of Worlds
post.content:
I think this news is worthy of a second blog today. All 6 current GB MacRob were knocked out today or earlier.

  1. Jonathan Kirby did not qualify.
  2. Keith Aiton out in Round of 32.
  3. Mark Avery out in Round of 32.
  4. Robert Fulford out in Round of 16.
  5. Chris Clarke out in Round of 16.
  6. David Maugham out in Round of 16.

I've just realised that no current MacRob are still in the knockout draw.
post.post-name: All Great Britian MacRob players out of Worlds

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 5, Day of MAJOR upsets
post.content:
No major upsets caused by me. Just 2 games. 1 z game which I won, 2 from 2 in that event but don't know what the minimum games required is to make the finals on Saturday. In the plate I won my first round to process side (second chance) against AJ Haken (Reid). Ugly game but won by 2.

Now onto the major upsets.

Robert Fletcher, Aus, 15 years old, World #13 beat David (The Beast) Maugham World #10 in 5 games. Very exciting match. Robert won the first 2. In the 5th he missed the peg out to complete the triple but peg out the other ball. Both players played the 2 vs 1 well until The Beast stuck in hoop 6 and Robert hit the 14 yarder to win the game.

Ben Rotham, USA, World #18 beat Robert Fulford World #2 several times winner of this event 3 - 0.

James Death, UK, World #27 beat Chris Clarke, UK, World #1, defending champion in 4 games.

http://2009worldchampionship.com/ is now the best site for results including links to live commentary.
post.post-name: Worlds 2009, Day 5, Day of MAJOR upsets

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 5, Day of MAJOR upsets
comment.content: Glad you had a good day Tim, Exciting stuff in the main event are you able to watch and play ?

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 5, Day of MAJOR upsets
comment.content:
Pete,
With only 2 games yesterday I had plenty of time to watch. When I did play I was on courts that easily keep an eye on the other games without distraction.

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 4, Better then same bad crap
post.content:
First game of plate today against Tommy Harrington was better. Hit 4th turn, run h5 long and missed returned roquet. Next error was straight rover peel, strickers did not run hoop. Won +26.

Second game against Ed Cunningham was same lack of concentration crap. Had good chance to win game on 4b and going to peg but stuck in 4b from no where. Ed hit short one, finished his break from penult to peg, crossed wired me at 1, i missed he finished from 2b.

That knocks me out of the draw side of the plate. I start process side (2nd bite of cherry for non-croquet players) on Friday. Will have to hang around at HQ tomorrow waiting for adhoc z games.

Starting to look forward to going home.
post.post-name: Worlds 2009, Day 4, Better then same bad crap

post.title: Worlds 2009, Rest Day
post.content:
Great rest day for me; much sleep. Plate tomorrow but still to find out when/where/who to play. Communication for the event has been poor.

5 Aussies have qualified. Results are now being posted at http://2009worldchampionship.com/ although not as frequently as everyone would like.

I guess we are blessed to have excellent systems and people support to ensure OZ tournament results are posted in a timely fashion.
All the best with the plate.
Love the pics... relays the atmosphere of whats going on.

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 3, Bugger
post.content: Just a quick update for now. Beat Ron with a TP but lost to Clarke and Death. Especially against Death I screwed up. Oh well onward and upward for the plate. Back to the beer.

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
post.content:
First game was against Ed Ducworth. He beat Clarke and Death day 1 so was in fine touch. For the first half of the game the croquet gods were not on my side. After 3.5 hours I pegged out the front ball 15 seconds before time, second ball 5 seconds after time. It was a real battle and very pleased with myself to hang in there.

Second game against Johnny Osborn. He played great to beat be 26-12. I made 2 errors and 3 poor roquet attempts.

Third game against Alan Morris. Played great with 2 peels of triple completed. Won 26-6.

So I'm 3 wins from 6 games. Tomorrow I have Ron Lloyd, Chris Clarke & James Death. Unfortunately the website so I don't really know how many wins are needed to qualify but best guess is 5 wins will get into tie break play off, 6 straight through. Fingers crossed.

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content: Keep on going Tim. It's a big pity that the web site for the championships is proving useless. It looks pretty but there are still no results from day 2. How easy it would have been if they'd been using your results program as we do in Oz *sigh*

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content:
Beats me how Chris Williams can update the World Rankings but the official website still does not any of todays results.
I looks possible that 8 people from my block could qualify or be in ties for qualification. I think 5 wins (2 from 3 for me tomorrow) is a good chance of making a play off.

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content: Well Done Tim, you always play better when your back is against the wall. I am looking foward to hearing about tommorrow's festivites- the atmosphere should be great! Enjoying the blog too!

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content: Well done Tim. Bet you can't wait to face up against Chris and the Death man. All the very best of good luck for tomorrow, Day 3.

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content: Well done Tim, know you can do it...

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content: Well done today Tim. Best of luck tomorrow. Liz & Ian

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 2, Good and Bad
comment.content: Tim, if it helps, suggest a big bowl of ice cream and be the ball.

post.title: Worlds 2009, Day 1, Not good
post.content:
"Not happy Jan". Played the three players directly ranked below me today, only won 1 needed 2 really.

First game against Martin Murray. Got off the a nervy/excited start a few errors. However managed to complete the 9, then Martin completed his 9, i hit and finished with TP. 4b peel rushed before h6, last 2 straight. Penult peelee went through great to about 2 yards in front of rover however strikers just snuck through require a sweep shot to hit escape.

Second game against Jame Le Moignan. Made 3rd turn 9. Long lift missed, just. Rolled oppo from c4 before h3 to set up on time triple, peel missed and bounced back about 2 inches (very few peel attempts stay in jaws like normal hoops). Made h4 with roll back to h3, pulled up a bit short was not trying for rush peel but of course peelee went in jaw. Take off to h5 7 yard wide made roquet but roll was short and angle attempt failed. Bit of back and forth until James was peg and 4b vs my peg and 6; he forgot to peg off both balls. James kept mucking up but always leaving me long shots. Finally got in with peg ball and I pegged him off; me 6 and peg vs 4b and box. Took a little while to start playing 2 balls smart but then James started hitting everything, c2 to c4 or similar 3 times, once when both balls wired, he used the wind and court. I finally got in with 4b ball, made some good short breaks until stick in 4b but that was fine. James missed my reception ball, I made 4b rush to James, rush to penult make it, rush back to partner, rush partner to near peg. With the super hoops decided to do equal roll to rover, strikers rolled a little off and totally fluffed the hoop. James hit and finished.

Third game against Duncan Dixon. Poor start, bit hot and tied. Eventually Duncan 9/12/5 to win. Both short lifts of mine missed by cigarette papers.

So though road ahead to qualify. Probably need a minimum of 5 from next 6 with the top 3 seeds to play. Tomorrow is Ed Duckworth, Johnny Osborn, Alan Morris.

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 1, Not good
comment.content: All the best tomorrow Tim, hope you can get three wins to make the task a bit easier, You must of been playing pretty well today , Tp first game followed by 3rd turn nine and a standard triple rolling. Cheers Pete

comment.title: re: Worlds 2009, Day 1, Not good
comment.content: The hitting by James and Duncan yesterday was best I've ever seen.

comment.title: re: The Draw
comment.content:
Hi Tim, good start, Why is the order of play not appear to be seeded and different from one block to another ?
Cheers Pete L.
Have put a Florida time clock on the computer , so got up early to see if any results got posted.

comment.title: re: The Draw
comment.content:
Pete,
Its not a seeded draw. It was in NZ but not UK. Don't know the reasons but its stupid. Every block has the same draw but the player letter/number within each block was randomingly drawn. eg Clarke may be number 3 in block and Fulford number 8. Madness.
Tim

post.title: 15 hours until hit off
post.content:
Better practice today. Have had trouble with concentration but a chat with Liz today has really helped, thanks Liz.

Most of the Aussies headed up to PGA Resort for practice.  They are much slower than here are NCC. Best guess 10 seconds. Flat as in court but a few of the boundaries roll away a bit. I expect several sextuples to be attempted and completed at this venue. The sad thing about practice there today is they only had Sunshiny balls and wide standard hoops. There will be Dawsons and Super Hoops there tomorrow when I play there. 6 of the 8 blocks have one day at PGA.

Details of the blocks have still not hit the net. I know what order I'm playing people but with 3.75 games being played on each court each day no idea when my byes will be. Hopefully we will find out more at the players meeting tonight.

Speaking of the players meeting reminds me that my Australian jacket arrived safe and sound. Only problem is its a bit snug around the back. Can't imagine why Mum and I double checked every measurement and went over not under. Oh well nothing I can do about it know.

Leaving now to get prettied up for the Opening Ceremony and players meeting. Hopefully a good nights sleep tonight and reports of winning. May not get internet access tomorrow night.

post.title: Draw is out
post.content:
The draw came out about 16 hours ago but to date I can't find it posted on the net anyway. So that I don't potentially piss anyone off I'll just my block for now.

post.title: Fletcher * 3 in the Worlds
post.content: All 3 Fletcher boys are in the Worlds! Robert had already been selected, Greg won 12 from 14 in the qualifier. Malcolm came 9th which initially meant he missed out but Nelson Morrow in 6th declined his position due to work commitments. Then Rhys Tomas and Tony Hall each declined their spots due to refereeing commitments. Therefore Malcolm has earned the 6th qualifying spot. Still be confirmed but its believed at 14 that Malcolm is the youngest player in the Worlds all time. We are all so excited for them both. Go Fletcher!

post.title: Super Hoops.
post.content:
The Americans specifically created a new set of hoops for the World Championships; they dubbed them "super hoops". I was literally about to start writing this blog when Stephen Forster placed the balls in hoop 5 court 10.

 Copyright Simon Watkins

 Copyright Simon Watkins

The hoops must be respected. They can be run softly, even from a fair angle. Try to hit the ball hard through the hoop; forget it. 6 ft out at 2b to bash through to the boundary; bad idea. Try a jump shot for an angly hoop; good luck. The hoops will present the challenge that deserves a World Championship.

My practice today was so so but really enjoying myself. All the Aussies have arrived. Lets hope we all get over the jet lag soon.

comment.title: re: Super Hoops.
comment.content:
Good to see that they're not going to make it easy for you!!
Best of luck...

comment.title: re: Super Hoops.
comment.content: Hoops and courts look great, Australian team photo if possible please Tim, Cheers Pete

comment.title: re: Super Hoops.
comment.content: Good luck for the Worlds. Must keep checking this here blog. Wish I was there. PJC.

comment.title: re: Super Hoops.
comment.content:
Ergh, I just noticed I have an Ozzie flag after my name in that previous comment.
All fixed now...

comment.title: re: Super Hoops.
comment.content: Simon's people have been in touch with my people :-) Photos courtesy (and copyright) of Simon Watkins.

post.title: Landed in Florida
post.content:
To follow are details of my flights to Florida. From the airport came straight to the courts. Have had a bit of a hit. Played well and then when I add on the fact I've not seen a bed from 40+ hours played great. Robert Fletcher is in fine form; he says today was the first day he felt good on the court since arriving. Leo McBride (Canada) peel rover straight for sextuple but strikers could not run hoop. The courts are good but now where near as flat as we thought they would be. Running at 12 seconds which is nice and comfortable, hopefully they'll get a bit quicker. Can't really comment on the new super hoops yet. The practice court has them set in old standard hoop holes so they are not as hard in the ground as others are suggesting they can be.

Eyes are popping out of my head but determined to stay up to 9pm local time to try and adjust the body clock quickly. Catch up again tomorrow.

Canberra to Sydney

AEST: Monday, 4th May at 8:10pm

Who would have thought the flight from Canberra to Sydney would be interesting enough for me to write about. Note I said interesting enough to write not necessarily interesting enough read.

Everyone’s on the plane ready for scheduled takeoff at 4:15pm. That was until 2 unaccompanied kids (roughly 7 & 10) start screaming blue murder, one in particular screaming quite loudly “let me off the plane, I’ve got to get off the plane” and it worked. Nicky and I were sitting next to them in the airport, seems like they will be staying with grandma a little while longer.

Due into Sydney at 5pm, actually arrived at 5:40pm after offloading the kids. Got to International Airport walked straight up to the check in counter. About two hours to kill; smoking several cigarettes, a couple of phone calls, buy $US, buy cheap grog and cigarettes, wrote up this blog and its time to board.

Sydney to LA

AEST: Monday, 4th May at 11:35pm

The plane’s computer is telling me the following: Sydney 11:35pm, LA  6:35am. Altitude 10,668 m, Distance from Sydney 3437km, Distance to LAX 4710km, Time to LAX 9h 39m, Outside Temperature -45C, Air Speed 912 kph.

Flying V Australia. It’s a new plane and smells like a new car. Best guess its 2/3 full and I have a spare seat next to which makes a big difference. Asked for a exit row seat but that pleasure was going to cost $150. Glad I saved my money; there’s actually a reasonable amount of leg room.

It’s been about 10 years since I flew long haul. Individual screens with wide selection of movies, TV & games make a big difference. Boredom factor not bad at the moment. “Love the Beast” by Eric Bana was a great yarn, currently watching Boston Legal one of favourite shows. And know I’ve just learnt they can charge my computer for me when needed, what a ripper.

Now can someone explain this to me? We’ve been travelling for nearly 4 hours to cover 3437km, average speed 860 kph. The current speed is 912 kph but lets us the current average of 860 kph with 4710 km which by my calculations is 5.16 hours to go. The plane’s computer says 9h 39m to go, that’s an average speed of 490 kph. Why such a big difference?

Time for a nap.

Arrive in LA

AEST: Tuesday, 5th May at 1:00pm, LA: Monday, 4th May at 8:00pm

Landed near scheduled time of 5pm local time, (Tuesday 10am AEST). Good flight. Probably got 4-5 hours sleep. Could have been more but wanted to start to get the body clock adjusted.

About 8 people in front of me at immigration but still took some time. They fingerprint and photograph everyone. That doesn’t take too long it just seemed like there were a couple of people with “issues”. Bag was waiting for me and then straight through customs. This is going great…

Straight out of terminal group of official looking blokes as guides/helpers for LAX. They were very helpful but were actually working for a charity, what’s $2 going to hurt me. Time for a smoke or three. The nicotine lozenge actually worked very well but there’s nothing like the real thing.

Walk across 2 terminals (perfect directions for $2) to Delta. Self check in, I don’t seem to have the write length booking number. No problems someone comes to help. We see my name on the screen but “can not find electronic ticket”, what the? At least 30 mins later with much tapping on the keyboard and 3 phone call I have my boarding passes. Time for some more smokes.

Damn hungry and no food outlets outside of the security area, oh well through I go.

  • Check point 1, checks I have a boarding pass and passport. Friendly. 
  • Check point 2, does the same but this time get stamp on boarding pass, much closer look at passport photo and infrared light goes over the passport. Unfriendly.
  • Check point 3, Xray and metal detector machine. On top of the now Australian practice of computer and liquids have to be taken out of bag the US requires all shoes to be taken off. Just plain RUDE.
  • Check point 4, check the boarding pass and passport again. OK.

This all took place around 7pm, 4 hours before my flight to Atlanta, I was going to go back out for a smoke after dinner but its truly not worth the hassle. Well that’s the way I feel right now, might change in an hour or so.

Phone and computer on charger. Which there was a human charger. Off to find a red bull and fingers crossed for some free internet access.

PS. Just worked out its 14 hours different between Florida and Canberra. So lets see if this burnt out brain can get the math right. Left Canberra Monday, 16:15. Arrive Florida Tuesday, 10:15. Add 14 hours for get Wednesday 00:15 Canberra time. 32 hours of my live has just disappeared. It will be 43 hours since laying eyes on a bed. Please tell me I’m wrong!

PPS. Had 2 large beers, am seriously tired. Nodding off in front of computer. Board in 10 mins, asleep in 20 I’d guess. Bugger its only a 4h 20m flight.

LA to Atlanta

AEST: Tuesday, 5th May at 9:00pm. Atlanta: Tuesday, 5th May at 7:00am

29 hours since I left Canberra.

Heart flutter as I tried to board. The boarding pass scanner gave an error noise rather than the ok noise everyone before me got. Fortunately she went straight on computer and all ok within 15 seconds.

What is it about Americans and carry on luggage. They now have limits compared to last time I was in the US but the limits are huge.

Then we started taxiing out and stopped for 10 mins while they fixed the air conditioner. Got some poor sleep in.

Atlanta airport is huge. Was starting to make my way over to terminal T, made a wrong turn into a bar. Was about to walk straight out when I smelt smoke. Smoking in an airport, what a luxury.

Atlanta to Florida

Incident free. As you've now read picked up from airport and straight to courts. Out for another quick practice.

post.title: Space Shuttle launch during Worlds
post.content:
Just found out that on Monday May 11 (Day 3 of Worlds) that NASA will be launching a space shuttle at 2:01 pm. The launch is from Cape Canaveral about 200 miles north of West Palm Beach. We will be lucky enough to see it fly over the croquet courts?

Shame the launch isn't a day later. Tuesday is playoff block tiebreak day, so a rest day for most players. If not playing in the playoff it would be worth the trip.

comment.title: re: Space Shuttle launch during Worlds
comment.content: Good luck big fella. Keep your head down during the launch, remember 1000's of parts all made by the lowest bidder!

comment.title: re: Space Shuttle launch during Worlds
comment.content:
Good luck my friend. :)
Take pics of the launch, that's a gotta see. Of course I understand that you may be busy...

post.title: Canberra Club Champion
post.content:
Pleased to report I won the club championships for the second year running. Beat Alan Honey 26-14, 26tp-4. Far to many mistakes in the first game but the second was better with just one mistake not running 2b cleanly. Game reports as I can best remember to follow. Well I just learnt I can't remember games well enough after 24 hours to write a full report. Lesson learnt for Worlds. Highlights and lowlights to follow.

Game 1. Tim made H1 with each ball but stuffed up each time before H2. Did all 3 peels before 2b to go on and fail 4b. 5 more turns to finish.

Game 2. 7th turn 8, could not hit after 2b. 9th turn made 3b with great leave. 10th turn Alan hits and fails H5. Tim finishes with TP.

comment.title: re: Canberra Club Champion
comment.content: Yes you won the club championship but i did win the case of beer in the VB cup! Good luck in the worlds and I will meet in you in the champion of champions final for a rematch!

comment.title: re: Canberra Club Champion
comment.content:
Head down Tim!
Smoooooth.....loose as a goose!
FUN
wish we could be there too. Lizzie & Ian

post.title: Welcome
post.content:
Welcome. What a boring first title!

Finally in the 21st century and got myself a blog. Why have I started it now when I've far too many things do before I head to Florida? Because I am heading to Florida to play in the World Championships, just 3 more sleeps. I figured a blog and twitter would be the best way for me to provide updates while I'm away. Having said that not sure how much internet access I'll have. We will have access at the National Croquet Center and maybe at the PGA National Club but probably not where we are staying. I'll do my best to write a blog each day, even if its just the results for the day (hopefully with me winning my fair share).

You might like to save one or more of the following links to your favourites:

  • My Blog. Includes twitter updates on the right hand side.
  • My Twitter page.
  • The official website of the World Championships.
  • My blog RSS feed.
  • My twitter RSS feed. 

What's an RSS feed?

If your not already using RSS then don't worry about it, just keep going back to my blog's home page.

But if you are interested. "RSS solves a problem for people who regularly use the web. It allows you to easily stay informed by retrieving the latest content from the sites you are interested in. You save time by not needing to visit each site individually. You ensure your privacy, by not needing to join each site's email newsletter." WhatIsRSS.com.

OK, on with some real work.

PS. Like the domain name?

comment.title: re: Welcome
comment.content:
Hi Tim,
Greetings from Brisbane, thanks 4 the link and best wishes for the Worlds. Will be following your progress with interest.

comment.title: re: Welcome
comment.content: aussie aussie aussie, oh oh oh!!! best of luck ! from the flights ps Alexander started high school this year.

comment.title: re: Welcome
comment.content: your airtime/distance differential may be due to "miles left" being land miles whereas you are one kilometre up in the air so the flight arc is much further. Either that or they were expecting some serious head winds

comment.title: re: Welcome
comment.content: Best of luck Tim, Can't find the F*#.)@N draw anywhere and yes is pissing me off, Pete L
